page.title: 01Gazetteer
page.content: The greater part of the area consists of farmland,however,it does contain the small village of North Stifford; part of Orsett village and a large housing estate which is a part of the town of Grays Thurrock. {North Stifford A small village of a mainly ribbon type settlement situated along the B.186 road from Grays to South Ockendon. {The Stifford Clays Estate,Pop,5104. Built between 1950-1955 to the North of the original A13 road from Grays to Southend.It forms the northerly border of Grays. {Baker Street Part of Orsett village which lies to the east of the survey area. {The Mar Dyke,}A small river which runs through the area and eventually into the Thames.
